Overt Act.definition: an act directed toward another person that indicates an intent to kill or harm and that justifies self-defense 2

1.definition: an act directed toward another person that indicates an intent to kill or harm and that justifies self-defense

2.definition: an outward act that is done in furtherance of a conspiracy, of treason, or of the crime of attempt and that is usually a required element of such crimes for conviction even if it is legal in itself
